intro: Opuntia verschaffeltii var. longispina, commonly known as the long-spined devil’s claw, is a succulent cactus native to South Africa. It features flattened, ribbed stems that are typically green to bluish-green in color. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers during the summer months. Its spines are long and sharp, providing protection from herbivores. It thrives in arid environments and requires well-draining soil and minimal water.
